intro: Comesperma tasmanicum, commonly known as the Tasmanian comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Tasmania. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
